critique: The document expresses concern about the spread of epidemic cerebrospinal meningitis and aims to prevent its introduction into the United States. The primary emotions the President wants to elicit are fear (to highlight the danger of the disease), and a sense of security and relief (by implementing measures to prevent its spread). There might also be a hint of disgust towards the disease itself. Surprise is not really relevant here, and joy and sadness are not directly conveyed. The initial scores are based on this assessment. The revised scores reflect a more nuanced understanding after further consideration.
